contentrichtext.text: In [[telecommunication]], the term '''reradiation''' has the following meanings: #[[Electromagnetic radiation]], at the same or different wavelengths, ''i.e.,'' frequencies, of energy received from an incident wave. #Undesirable radiation of signals locally generated in a [[radio]] receiver. This type of radiation might cause [[Interference (communication)|interference]] or reveal the location of the device.''' [[Near and far field|Near-field]] effects of an AM [[Antenna (radio)|antenna]] may extend out two miles (3 km) or more. [[Cellular network|Cellular]] and [[microwave]] towers within this radius can reflect the AM [[Signal (electronics)|signal]] out at a different [[frequency]]. This process results in interfering frequencies called '''reradiation'''.<ref>[http://www.lbagroup.com/associates/lbatn102.php Detuning Communications Towers Solves Reradiation Problem: Technical Note 102]</ref> {{FS1037C MS188}} {{Reflist}} [[Category:Radio communications]] {{radio-comm-stub}}
